data.name: 9.1.1 Control of  virtual resources
data.description: A plan for control of creating, changing and collecting virtual resources (virtual machine, virtual storage, virtual software, etc.) should be established

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

tests.title: Any Host Root Access
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances root user cannot be accessed from any host
tests.more_info: Root access for SQL instance should only be allowed from whitelisted IPs to ensure secure access only from trusted entities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that root access for SQL instances are not allowed from any host.

tests.title: Instance Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that compute instances are not configured to allow public access.
tests.more_info: Compute Instances should always be configured behind load balancers instead of having public IP addresses in order to minimize the instance's exposure to the internet.
tests.recommended_action: Modify compute instances and set External IP to None for network interface

tests.title: KMS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are not publicly accessible.
tests.more_info: To prevent exposing sensitive data and information leaks, make sure that your cryptokeys do not allow access from anonymous and public users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your cryptographic keys are not accessible by allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 9.1.3 Monitoring of  virtual resources
data.description: Safeguards to secure the integrity of virtual resources and changes to virtual resources (modification, relocation, deletion, copying) should be monitored. In addition, the user should be notified of any damage to virtual resources.

tests.title: Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have monitoring enabled
tests.more_info: Kubernetes supports monitoring through Stackdriver.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure monitoring is enabled on all Kubernetes clusters.

tests.title: Integrity Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes shielded cluster node have integrity monitoring enabled
tests.more_info: Integrity Monitoring feature automatically monitors the integrity of your cluster nodes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Integrity Monitoring feature for your cluster nodes

tests.title: Open Cassandra Monitoring
tests.description: Determines if TCP port 7199 for Cassandra Monitoring is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Cassandra Monitoring should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 7199 to known IP addresses.

data.name: 9.1.5 Public server security
data.description: Physical and technical safeguards for websites where virtual resources are provided and public servers used to distribute virtual software (mobile and desktop apps) should be established.

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Instance Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that compute instances are not configured to allow public access.
tests.more_info: Compute Instances should always be configured behind load balancers instead of having public IP addresses in order to minimize the instance's exposure to the internet.
tests.recommended_action: Modify compute instances and set External IP to None for network interface

tests.title: Public Disk Images
tests.description: Ensure that your disk images are not being shared publicly.
tests.more_info: To avoid exposing sensitive information, make sure that your virtual machine disk images are not being publicly shared with all other GCP accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your VM disk images are not accessible by allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 10.1.1 Establishment of access control policy
data.description: An access control policy that includes the areas and scope of access control and the rules and methods of access control should be established to ensure control of unauthorized access.

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

tests.title: VM Instances Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures that instances are not configured to use the default service account with full access to all cloud APIs
tests.more_info: To support the principle of least privilege and prevent potential privilege escalation, it is recommended that instances are not assigned to the default service account, Compute Engine default service account with a scope allowing full access to all cloud APIs.
tests.recommended_action: For all instances, if the default service account is used, ensure full access to all cloud APIs is not configured.

tests.title: Cluster Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures Kubernetes clusters using default service account are using minimal service account access scopes
tests.more_info: As a best practice, Kubernetes clusters should not be created with default service account. But if they are, Kubernetes default service account should be limited to minimal access scopes necessary to operate the clusters.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters are created with minimal access scope.

tests.title: Legacy Authorization Disabled
tests.description: Ensure legacy authorization is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: The legacy authorizer in Kubernetes grants broad, statically defined permissions.
tests.recommended_action: Disable legacy authorization on all clusters.

tests.title: Master Authorized Network
tests.description: Ensures master authorized networks is set to enabled on Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: Authorized networks are a way of specifying a restricted range of IP addresses that are permitted to access your container clusters Kubernetes master endpoint.
tests.recommended_action: Enable master authorized networks on all clusters.

tests.title: Any Host Root Access
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances root user cannot be accessed from any host
tests.more_info: Root access for SQL instance should only be allowed from whitelisted IPs to ensure secure access only from trusted entities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that root access for SQL instances are not allowed from any host.

tests.title: Basic Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensure basic authentication is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters.
tests.more_info: Basic authentication uses static passwords to authenticate, which is not the recommended method to authenticate into the Kubernetes API server.
tests.recommended_action: Disable basic authentication on all clusters

tests.title: SQL Contained Database Authentication
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances of SQL Server type have Contained Database Authentication flag disabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling Contained Database Authentication flag allows users to connect to the database without authenticating a login at the Database Engine level along with other security threats.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Contained Database Authentication flag is disabled for all SQL Server instances.

tests.title: Bucket Uniform Level Access
tests.description: Ensures that uniform level access is enabled on storage buckets.
tests.more_info: Uniform level access for buckets can be used for managing access in a simple way. It enables us to use other security features like IAM conditions.
tests.recommended_action: Make sure that storage buckets have uniform level access enabled
tests.remediation_description: Unfiorm Level Access will be enabled on all storage buckets

results.message: Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled
Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled

tests.title: Instance Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that compute instances are not configured to allow public access.
tests.more_info: Compute Instances should always be configured behind load balancers instead of having public IP addresses in order to minimize the instance's exposure to the internet.
tests.recommended_action: Modify compute instances and set External IP to None for network interface

tests.title: Disable Serial Port Access
tests.description: Determine if "Disable VM serial port access" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: For security purposes, ensure that serial port access to your VM instances is disabled.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Disable VM serial port access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Disable VM serial port access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: Enforce Uniform Bucket-Level Access
tests.description: Determine if "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" policy is enabled at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing Uniform Bucket Level Access ensures that access is granted exclusively through Cloud IAM service which is more efficient and secure.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: Enforce Restrict Authorized Networks
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict Authorized Networks on Cloud SQL instances" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing "Restrict Authorized Networks on Cloud SQL instances" organization policy, restricts adding authorized networks for unproxied database access to Cloud SQL instances.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict Authorized Networks on Cloud SQL instances" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Restrict Authorized Networks on Cloud SQL instances" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: KMS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are not publicly accessible.
tests.more_info: To prevent exposing sensitive data and information leaks, make sure that your cryptokeys do not allow access from anonymous and public users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your cryptographic keys are not accessible by allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 10.2.1 User registration and provisioning
data.description: To control access to cloud systems and material information, an official procedure for registering and deleting users should be established and a minimum of access permissions should be granted to users on the basis of their business needs.

tests.title: VM Instances Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures that instances are not configured to use the default service account with full access to all cloud APIs
tests.more_info: To support the principle of least privilege and prevent potential privilege escalation, it is recommended that instances are not assigned to the default service account, Compute Engine default service account with a scope allowing full access to all cloud APIs.
tests.recommended_action: For all instances, if the default service account is used, ensure full access to all cloud APIs is not configured.

tests.title: Cluster Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures Kubernetes clusters using default service account are using minimal service account access scopes
tests.more_info: As a best practice, Kubernetes clusters should not be created with default service account. But if they are, Kubernetes default service account should be limited to minimal access scopes necessary to operate the clusters.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters are created with minimal access scope.

data.name: 10.2.2 Control of admin and special permissions
data.description: Accounts and permissions granted for control of cloud systems and material information and other special purposes should be identified and controlled separately.

tests.title: Service Account Separation
tests.description: Ensures that no users have both the Service Account User and Service Account Admin role.
tests.more_info: Ensuring that no users have both roles follows separation of duties, where no user should have access to resources out of the scope of duty.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have both the Service Account User and Service Account Admin role attached.

tests.title: KMS User Separation
tests.description: Ensures that no users have the KMS admin role and any one of the CryptoKey roles.
tests.more_info: Ensuring that no users have the KMS admin role and any one of the CryptoKey roles follows separation of duties, where no user should have access to resources out of the scope of duty.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have both the KMS admin role and any of CryptoKey roles attached.

data.name: 10.3.2 User authentication
data.description: Access to cloud systems should be controlled through a secure user authentication procedure, including user authentication, maximum login attempts, and warning of unauthorized login attempts.

tests.title: OS Login Enabled
tests.description: Ensures OS login is enabled for the project
tests.more_info: Enabling OS login ensures that SSH keys used to connect to instances are mapped with IAM users.
tests.recommended_action: Set enable-oslogin in project-wide metadata so that it applies to all of the instances in the project.

tests.title: Basic Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensure basic authentication is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters.
tests.more_info: Basic authentication uses static passwords to authenticate, which is not the recommended method to authenticate into the Kubernetes API server.
tests.recommended_action: Disable basic authentication on all clusters

tests.title: SQL Contained Database Authentication
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances of SQL Server type have Contained Database Authentication flag disabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling Contained Database Authentication flag allows users to connect to the database without authenticating a login at the Database Engine level along with other security threats.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Contained Database Authentication flag is disabled for all SQL Server instances.

tests.title: OS Login 2FA Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machines instances have OS logic feature enabled and configured with Two-Factor Authentication.
tests.more_info: Enable OS login Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) to add an additional security layer to your VM instances. The risk of your VM instances getting attcked is reduced significantly if 2FA is enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Set enable-oslogin-2fa to true in custom metadata for the instance.

tests.title: Enforce Require OS Login
tests.description: Determine if "Require OS Login" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enabling OS Login at project level will ensure that the SSH keys being used to access your VM instances are mapped with Cloud IAM users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Require OS Login" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Require OS Login" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 11.1.1 Establishment of network security policy
data.description: A security policy and procedure concerning internal and external networks related to cloud computing services should be established.

tests.title: Storage Bucket All Users Policy
tests.description: Ensures Storage bucket policies do not allow global write, delete, or read permissions
tests.more_info: Storage buckets can be configured to allow the global principal to access the bucket via the bucket policy. This policy should be restricted only to known users or accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each storage bucket is configured so that no member is set to allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

tests.title: Security Policy Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all backend services have an attached security policy
tests.more_info: Security policies on backend services control the traffic on the load balancer. This creates edge security and can deny or allow specified IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all load balancers have an attached Cloud Armor security policy.

tests.title: Network Policy Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have network policy enabled
tests.more_info: Kubernetes network policy creates isolation between cluster pods, this creates a more secure environment with only specified connections allowed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable network policy on all Kubernetes clusters.

tests.title: Pod Security Policy Enabled
tests.description: Ensures pod security policy is enabled for all Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: Kubernetes pod security policy is a resource that controls security sensitive aspects of the pod configuration.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters have pod security policy enabled.

tests.title: Storage Bucket Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures bucket retention policy is set and locked to prevent deleting or updating of bucket objects or retention policy.
tests.more_info: Configuring retention policy for bucket prevents accidental deletion as well as modification of bucket objects. This retention policy should also be locked to prevent policy deletion.
tests.recommended_action: Modify bucket to configure retention policy and lock retention policy.

results.message: Storage bucket does not have a retention policy
Storage bucket does not have a retention policy

tests.title: Dataset All Users Policy
tests.description: Ensure that BigQuery datasets do not allow public read, write or delete access.
tests.more_info: Granting permissions to allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers allows anyone to access the dataset. Such access might not be desirable if sensitive data is being stored in the dataset.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each dataset is configured so that no member is set to allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 11.1.2 Monitoring and control of network
data.description: Networks should be monitored and controlled to prevent service downtime and leakage of material information due to DDoS and unauthorized access, etc.

tests.title: Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have monitoring enabled
tests.more_info: Kubernetes supports monitoring through Stackdriver.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure monitoring is enabled on all Kubernetes clusters.

tests.title: Integrity Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes shielded cluster node have integrity monitoring enabled
tests.more_info: Integrity Monitoring feature automatically monitors the integrity of your cluster nodes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Integrity Monitoring feature for your cluster nodes

tests.title: Open Cassandra Monitoring
tests.description: Determines if TCP port 7199 for Cassandra Monitoring is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Cassandra Monitoring should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 7199 to known IP addresses.

data.name: 11.1.3 Operation of  network information  security system
data.description: Information security systems (firewall, IPS, IDS, VPN, etc.) should be operated to protect internal and external networks related to cloud computing services.

tests.title: Restrict VPN Peer IPs
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict VPN Peer IPs" is enforced on the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing the "Restrict VPN Peer IPs" constraint allows you to control the IP addresses which can be configured as VPN Peers.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict VPN Peer IPs" constraint is enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 11.1.4 Network encryption
data.description: Encrypted communication channels should be used for any section through which material information moves in a cloud system.

tests.title: CSEK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Customer Supplied Encryption Key Encryption is enabled on disks
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CSEK only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: CSEK can only be configured when creating a disk. Delete the disk and redeploy with CSEK.

tests.title: Database SSL Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL databases have SSL enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SSL ensures that the sensitive data being transferred from the database is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SSL is enabled on all SQL databases.

tests.title: SSL Certificate Rotation
tests.description: Ensure that server certificates configured for Cloud SQL are rotated before they expire.
tests.more_info: Server certificates configured for Cloud SQL DB instances should be rotated before they expire to ensure that incoming connections for database instance remain secure.
tests.recommended_action: Edit Cloud SQL DB instances and rotate server certificates under Connections->MANAGE CERTIFICATES

tests.title: Topic Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Google Pub/Sub topics are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all messages in topics by default. By using CSEK, only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Cloud Pub/Sub topics are encrypted using CSEK keys

tests.title: Node Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE cluster nodes are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: Using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) gives you better control over the encryption/decryption process of your cluster nodes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all node pools in GKE clusters have the desired encryption level.

tests.title: Cluster Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE clusters have KMS encryption enabled to encrypt application-layer secrets.
tests.more_info: Application-layer secrets encryption adds additional security layer to sensitive data such as Kubernetes secrets stored in etcd.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all GKE clusters have the desired application-layer secrets encryption level.

tests.title: Dataflow Jobs Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Google Dataflow jobs are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all jobs in Dataflow by default. Protecting source and sinks data for Dataflow batch pipeline with CMEK gives user more granular access to encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Use desired encryption level to encrypt Dataflow jobs.

tests.title: SQL CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: By default, your Google Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have a better control over the encryption process of your Cloud SQL instances you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Google Cloud SQL instances have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud Storage buckets have encryption enabled using desired protection level.
tests.more_info: By default, all storage buckets are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have better control over how your storage bucktes are encrypted, you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all storage buckets have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Tables CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that BigQuery dataset tables are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: By default Google encrypts all datasets using Google-managed encryption keys. To have more control over the encryption process of your BigQuery dataset tables you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each BigQuery dataset table has desired encryption level.

tests.title: VM Disks CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machine instances are encrypted using customer-managed keys.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CMKs you can have better control over your disk encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your VM instances have CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: Disable Default Encryption Creation
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" is enforced on the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Google-managed encryption keys for Cloud SQL database instances to enforce the use of Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs) in order to have complete control over database encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 11.1.5 Network segmentation
data.description: Network access should be physically or logically segregated among the admin area of the cloud computing service provider, user service area, and inter-user service area.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a VPC increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each VPC and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

tests.title: Restrict Shared VPC Subnetworks
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict Shared VPC Subnetworks" is enforced on the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing the "Restrict Shared VPC Subnetworks" constraint allows you to define which VPC Shared Subnetworks your resources can use within your GCP organization.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict Shared VPC Subnetworks" constraint is enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 12.1.1 Data classification
data.description: Data should be classified and managed on the basis of its type, legal requirements, sensitivity and materiality.

tests.title: Cluster Labels Added
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have labels added
tests.more_info: It is recommended to add labels to Kubernetes clusters to apply specific security settings and auto configure objects at creation.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure labels are added to Kubernetes clusters

data.name: 12.1.3 Data integrity
data.description: Data input/output, data transmission or exchange and data at rest should always be checked for its data integrity.

tests.title: DB Automated Backups
tests.description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for SQL instances
tests.more_info: Google provides a simple method of backing up SQL instances at a regular interval. This should be enabled to provide an option for restoring data in the event of a database compromise or hardware failure.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all database instances are configured with automatic backups enabled.

tests.title: VM Instances Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures that instances are not configured to use the default service account with full access to all cloud APIs
tests.more_info: To support the principle of least privilege and prevent potential privilege escalation, it is recommended that instances are not assigned to the default service account, Compute Engine default service account with a scope allowing full access to all cloud APIs.
tests.recommended_action: For all instances, if the default service account is used, ensure full access to all cloud APIs is not configured.

tests.title: Database SSL Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL databases have SSL enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SSL ensures that the sensitive data being transferred from the database is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SSL is enabled on all SQL databases.

tests.title: Cluster Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures Kubernetes clusters using default service account are using minimal service account access scopes
tests.more_info: As a best practice, Kubernetes clusters should not be created with default service account. But if they are, Kubernetes default service account should be limited to minimal access scopes necessary to operate the clusters.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters are created with minimal access scope.

tests.title: Audit Configuration Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in audit configuration should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.

tests.title: Audit Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that default audit logging is enabled on the organization or project.
tests.more_info: The default audit logs should be configured to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services. In addition, no exempted members should be added to the logs to ensure proper delivery of all audit logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the default audit logs are enabled to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services.

results.message: Audit logging is not enabled on the project

tests.title: Disk Automatic Backup Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Google Compute disks have scheduled snapshots configured.
tests.more_info: Having scheduled snapshots configured for your disks will periodically backup data from your persistent disks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all compute disks have a snapshot schedule attached.

tests.title: Detailed Audit Logging Mode
tests.description: Determine if "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" policy is configured at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Detailed Audit Logging Mode is highly encouraged in coordination with Bucket Lock when seeking compliances such as SEC Rule 17a-4(f), CFTC Rule 1.31(c)-(d), and FINRA Rule 4511(c).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 12.1.4 Data protection
data.description: Data protection functions, such as data access control and forgery prevention, should be provided to users.

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

tests.title: Any Host Root Access
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances root user cannot be accessed from any host
tests.more_info: Root access for SQL instance should only be allowed from whitelisted IPs to ensure secure access only from trusted entities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that root access for SQL instances are not allowed from any host.

tests.title: Bucket Uniform Level Access
tests.description: Ensures that uniform level access is enabled on storage buckets.
tests.more_info: Uniform level access for buckets can be used for managing access in a simple way. It enables us to use other security features like IAM conditions.
tests.recommended_action: Make sure that storage buckets have uniform level access enabled
tests.remediation_description: Unfiorm Level Access will be enabled on all storage buckets

results.message: Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled
Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled

tests.title: Instance Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that compute instances are not configured to allow public access.
tests.more_info: Compute Instances should always be configured behind load balancers instead of having public IP addresses in order to minimize the instance's exposure to the internet.
tests.recommended_action: Modify compute instances and set External IP to None for network interface

tests.title: VM Instance Deletion Protection
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machine instances have deletion protection enabled.
tests.more_info: VM instances should have deletion protection enabled in order to prevent them for being accidentally deleted.
tests.recommended_action: Modify VM instances to enable deletion protection

tests.title: Key Protection Level
tests.description: Ensure that cryptographic keys have protection level equal to or above desired protection level.
tests.more_info: Cloud KMS cryptographic keys should be created with protection level set by your organization's compliance and security rules.
tests.recommended_action: Create cryptographic keys according to desired protection level

tests.title: Topic Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Google Pub/Sub topics are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all messages in topics by default. By using CSEK, only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Cloud Pub/Sub topics are encrypted using CSEK keys

tests.title: VM Disks CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machine instances are encrypted using customer-managed keys.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CMKs you can have better control over your disk encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your VM instances have CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: Disable Serial Port Access
tests.description: Determine if "Disable VM serial port access" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: For security purposes, ensure that serial port access to your VM instances is disabled.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Disable VM serial port access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Disable VM serial port access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: Enforce Uniform Bucket-Level Access
tests.description: Determine if "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" policy is enabled at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing Uniform Bucket Level Access ensures that access is granted exclusively through Cloud IAM service which is more efficient and secure.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: KMS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are not publicly accessible.
tests.more_info: To prevent exposing sensitive data and information leaks, make sure that your cryptokeys do not allow access from anonymous and public users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your cryptographic keys are not accessible by allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 12.3.1 Establishment of encryption policy
data.description: To protect data at rest or in transit in a cloud computing service, a policy concerning encryption targets, encryption strength (complexity), key management, and password use, should be established. It should be ensured that the policy reflects legal requirements relating to encryption, such as encrypting personal data when it is stored or transmitted.

tests.title: Key Rotation
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are set to rotate on a regular schedule
tests.more_info: All cryptographic keys should have key rotation enabled. Google will handle the rotation of the encryption key itself, as well as storage of previous keys, so previous data does not need to be re-encrypted before the rotation occurs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that cryptographic keys are set to rotate.

tests.title: CSEK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Customer Supplied Encryption Key Encryption is enabled on disks
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CSEK only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: CSEK can only be configured when creating a disk. Delete the disk and redeploy with CSEK.

tests.title: Key Protection Level
tests.description: Ensure that cryptographic keys have protection level equal to or above desired protection level.
tests.more_info: Cloud KMS cryptographic keys should be created with protection level set by your organization's compliance and security rules.
tests.recommended_action: Create cryptographic keys according to desired protection level

tests.title: Topic Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Google Pub/Sub topics are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all messages in topics by default. By using CSEK, only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Cloud Pub/Sub topics are encrypted using CSEK keys

tests.title: Node Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE cluster nodes are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: Using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) gives you better control over the encryption/decryption process of your cluster nodes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all node pools in GKE clusters have the desired encryption level.

tests.title: Cluster Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE clusters have KMS encryption enabled to encrypt application-layer secrets.
tests.more_info: Application-layer secrets encryption adds additional security layer to sensitive data such as Kubernetes secrets stored in etcd.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all GKE clusters have the desired application-layer secrets encryption level.

tests.title: Dataflow Jobs Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Google Dataflow jobs are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all jobs in Dataflow by default. Protecting source and sinks data for Dataflow batch pipeline with CMEK gives user more granular access to encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Use desired encryption level to encrypt Dataflow jobs.

tests.title: SQL CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: By default, your Google Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have a better control over the encryption process of your Cloud SQL instances you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Google Cloud SQL instances have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud Storage buckets have encryption enabled using desired protection level.
tests.more_info: By default, all storage buckets are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have better control over how your storage bucktes are encrypted, you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all storage buckets have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Tables CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that BigQuery dataset tables are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: By default Google encrypts all datasets using Google-managed encryption keys. To have more control over the encryption process of your BigQuery dataset tables you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each BigQuery dataset table has desired encryption level.

tests.title: VM Disks CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machine instances are encrypted using customer-managed keys.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CMKs you can have better control over your disk encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your VM instances have CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: Disable Default Encryption Creation
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" is enforced on the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Google-managed encryption keys for Cloud SQL database instances to enforce the use of Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs) in order to have complete control over database encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 12.3.2 Encryption key management
data.description: A secure procedure concerning the creation, use, storage, distribution and destruction of encryption keys should be established, and encryption keys should be stored in a separate secure location.

tests.title: Key Rotation
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are set to rotate on a regular schedule
tests.more_info: All cryptographic keys should have key rotation enabled. Google will handle the rotation of the encryption key itself, as well as storage of previous keys, so previous data does not need to be re-encrypted before the rotation occurs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that cryptographic keys are set to rotate.

tests.title: Key Protection Level
tests.description: Ensure that cryptographic keys have protection level equal to or above desired protection level.
tests.more_info: Cloud KMS cryptographic keys should be created with protection level set by your organization's compliance and security rules.
tests.recommended_action: Create cryptographic keys according to desired protection level

data.name: 13.1.2 Authentication and  encryption functions
data.description: When a cloud system is designed, security requirements concerning user authentication must be taken into account, and legal requirements should also be considered where integrity and confidentiality are required in the process of inputting/outputting and transmitting/receiving material data.

tests.title: CSEK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Customer Supplied Encryption Key Encryption is enabled on disks
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CSEK only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: CSEK can only be configured when creating a disk. Delete the disk and redeploy with CSEK.

tests.title: OS Login Enabled
tests.description: Ensures OS login is enabled for the project
tests.more_info: Enabling OS login ensures that SSH keys used to connect to instances are mapped with IAM users.
tests.recommended_action: Set enable-oslogin in project-wide metadata so that it applies to all of the instances in the project.

tests.title: Database SSL Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL databases have SSL enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SSL ensures that the sensitive data being transferred from the database is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SSL is enabled on all SQL databases.

tests.title: Basic Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensure basic authentication is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters.
tests.more_info: Basic authentication uses static passwords to authenticate, which is not the recommended method to authenticate into the Kubernetes API server.
tests.recommended_action: Disable basic authentication on all clusters

tests.title: SQL Contained Database Authentication
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances of SQL Server type have Contained Database Authentication flag disabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling Contained Database Authentication flag allows users to connect to the database without authenticating a login at the Database Engine level along with other security threats.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Contained Database Authentication flag is disabled for all SQL Server instances.

tests.title: SSL Certificate Rotation
tests.description: Ensure that server certificates configured for Cloud SQL are rotated before they expire.
tests.more_info: Server certificates configured for Cloud SQL DB instances should be rotated before they expire to ensure that incoming connections for database instance remain secure.
tests.recommended_action: Edit Cloud SQL DB instances and rotate server certificates under Connections->MANAGE CERTIFICATES

tests.title: Topic Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Google Pub/Sub topics are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all messages in topics by default. By using CSEK, only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Cloud Pub/Sub topics are encrypted using CSEK keys

tests.title: Node Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE cluster nodes are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: Using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs) gives you better control over the encryption/decryption process of your cluster nodes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all node pools in GKE clusters have the desired encryption level.

tests.title: Cluster Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that GKE clusters have KMS encryption enabled to encrypt application-layer secrets.
tests.more_info: Application-layer secrets encryption adds additional security layer to sensitive data such as Kubernetes secrets stored in etcd.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all GKE clusters have the desired application-layer secrets encryption level.

tests.title: Dataflow Jobs Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Google Dataflow jobs are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all jobs in Dataflow by default. Protecting source and sinks data for Dataflow batch pipeline with CMEK gives user more granular access to encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Use desired encryption level to encrypt Dataflow jobs.

tests.title: OS Login 2FA Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machines instances have OS logic feature enabled and configured with Two-Factor Authentication.
tests.more_info: Enable OS login Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) to add an additional security layer to your VM instances. The risk of your VM instances getting attcked is reduced significantly if 2FA is enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Set enable-oslogin-2fa to true in custom metadata for the instance.

tests.title: SQL CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Customer Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: By default, your Google Cloud SQL instances are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have a better control over the encryption process of your Cloud SQL instances you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Google Cloud SQL instances have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Cloud Storage buckets have encryption enabled using desired protection level.
tests.more_info: By default, all storage buckets are encrypted using Google-managed keys. To have better control over how your storage bucktes are encrypted, you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all storage buckets have desired encryption level.

tests.title: Tables CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that BigQuery dataset tables are encrypted using desired encryption protection level.
tests.more_info: By default Google encrypts all datasets using Google-managed encryption keys. To have more control over the encryption process of your BigQuery dataset tables you can use Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each BigQuery dataset table has desired encryption level.

tests.title: VM Disks CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Virtual Machine instances are encrypted using customer-managed keys.
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CMKs you can have better control over your disk encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your VM instances have CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: Enforce Require OS Login
tests.description: Determine if "Require OS Login" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enabling OS Login at project level will ensure that the SSH keys being used to access your VM instances are mapped with Cloud IAM users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Require OS Login" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Require OS Login" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: Disable Default Encryption Creation
tests.description: Determine if "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" is enforced on the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Google-managed encryption keys for Cloud SQL database instances to enforce the use of Customer-Managed Keys (CMKs) in order to have complete control over database encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Restrict Default Google-Managed Encryption for Cloud SQL Instances" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

data.name: 13.1.3 Security log functions
data.description: A cloud system should be designed to collect audit trails concerning user authentication, change to permissions, use and leakage of material information, etc

tests.title: Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures object logging is enabled on storage buckets
tests.more_info: Storage bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of access that can be used in the event of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Bucket Logging can only be enabled by using the Command Line Interface and the log bucket must already be created. Use this command to enable Logging: gsutil logging set on -b gs://[LOG_BUCKET_NAME] -o AccessLog  gs://[BUCKET_NAME]

tests.title: Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC subnet

tests.title: Storage Permissions Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for storage permission changes
tests.more_info: Storage permissions include access to the buckets that store the logs, any changes in storage permissions should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert for storage permission changes.

tests.title: SQL Configuration Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for SQL configuration changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in SQL configurations should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for SQL configuration changes.

tests.title: Audit Configuration Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in audit configuration should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.

tests.title: Custom Role Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for custom role creation and changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in custom role should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log alerts exist for custom role creation and changes.

tests.title: VPC Firewall Rule Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for firewall rule changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in firewall rule should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for firewall rule changes.

tests.title: VPC Network Route Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for VPC network route changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in VPC network route should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for VPC network route changes.

tests.title: VPC Network Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for VPC network changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in VPC network should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for VPC network changes.

tests.title: Audit Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that default audit logging is enabled on the organization or project.
tests.more_info: The default audit logs should be configured to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services. In addition, no exempted members should be added to the logs to ensure proper delivery of all audit logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the default audit logs are enabled to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services.

results.message: Audit logging is not enabled on the project

tests.title: Log Sinks Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a log sink is enabled to export all logs
tests.more_info: Log sinks send log data to a storage service for archival and compliance. A log sink with no filter is necessary to ensure that all logs are being properly sent. If logs are sent to a storage bucket, the bucket must exist and bucket versioning should exist.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure a log sink is configured properly with an empty filter and a destination.

tests.title: Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have logging enabled
tests.more_info: This setting should be enabled to ensure Kubernetes control plane logs are properly recorded.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that logging is enabled on all Kubernetes clusters.

tests.title: PostgreSQL Log Lock Waits Flag Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances for PostgreSQL type have log_lock_waits flag enabled.
tests.more_info: SQL instance for PostgreSQL database provides log_lock_waits flag. It is not enabled by default. Enabling it will make sure that log messages are generated whenever a session waits longer than deadlock_timeout to acquire a lock.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log_lock_waits flag is enabled for all PostgreSQL instances.

tests.title: PostgreSQL Log Connections Flag Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances for PostgreSQL type have log connections flag enabled.
tests.more_info: SQL instance for PostgreSQL databases provides log_connections flag. It is used to log every attempt to connect to the db server. It is not enabled by default. Enabling it will make sure to log all connection tries
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log connections flag is enabled for all PostgreSQL instances.

tests.title: PostgreSQL Log Min Error Statement
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances for PostgreSQL type have log min error statement flag set to Error.
tests.more_info: SQL instance for PostgreSQL databases provides log_min_error_statement flag. It is used to mention/tag that the error messages. Setting it to Error value will help to find the error messages appropriately.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log_min_error_statement flag is set to Error for all PostgreSQL instances.

tests.title: PostgreSQL Log Temp Files
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances for PostgreSQL type have log temp files flag enabled.
tests.more_info: SQL instance for PostgreSQL databases provides log_temp_files flag. It is used to log the temporary files name and size. It is not enabled by default. Enabling it will make sure to log names and sizes of all the temporary files that were created during any operation(sort, hashes, query_results etc).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log_temp_files flag is enabled for all PostgreSQL instances.

tests.title: PostgreSQL Log Min Duration Statement
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances for PostgreSQL type have log min duration statement flag disabled.
tests.more_info: SQL instance for PostgreSQL databases provides log_min_duration_statement flag. It is used to log the duration of every completed statement. This should always be disabled as there can be sensitive information as well that should not be recorded in the logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log_min_duration_statement flag is disabled for all PostgreSQL instances.

tests.title: VPC DNS Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that All VPC Network has DNS logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Cloud DNS logging records the queries coming from Compute Engine VMs, GKE containers, or other GCP resources provisioned within the VPC to Stackdriver.
tests.recommended_action: Create Cloud DNS Server Policy with logging enabled for VPC Networks

tests.title: Firewall Logging Metadata
tests.description: Ensure that VPC Network firewall logging is configured to exclude logging metadata in order to reduce the size of the log files.
tests.more_info: You can significantly reduce the size of your log files and optimize storage costs by not including metadata. By default, metadata is included in firewall rule log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that metadata is not included in firewall rule log files.

tests.title: Detailed Audit Logging Mode
tests.description: Determine if "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" policy is configured at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Detailed Audit Logging Mode is highly encouraged in coordination with Bucket Lock when seeking compliances such as SEC Rule 17a-4(f), CFTC Rule 1.31(c)-(d), and FINRA Rule 4511(c).
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Detailed Audit Logging Mode" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

data.name: 13.1.4 Provisioning functions
data.description: A cloud system should be designed to grant access permissions on the basis of the purpose and materiality of business.

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

tests.title: Storage Permissions Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for storage permission changes
tests.more_info: Storage permissions include access to the buckets that store the logs, any changes in storage permissions should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert for storage permission changes.

tests.title: Any Host Root Access
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances root user cannot be accessed from any host
tests.more_info: Root access for SQL instance should only be allowed from whitelisted IPs to ensure secure access only from trusted entities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that root access for SQL instances are not allowed from any host.

tests.title: Bucket Uniform Level Access
tests.description: Ensures that uniform level access is enabled on storage buckets.
tests.more_info: Uniform level access for buckets can be used for managing access in a simple way. It enables us to use other security features like IAM conditions.
tests.recommended_action: Make sure that storage buckets have uniform level access enabled
tests.remediation_description: Unfiorm Level Access will be enabled on all storage buckets

results.message: Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled
Bucket does not have uniform bucket level access enabled

tests.title: Instance Public Access Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that compute instances are not configured to allow public access.
tests.more_info: Compute Instances should always be configured behind load balancers instead of having public IP addresses in order to minimize the instance's exposure to the internet.
tests.recommended_action: Modify compute instances and set External IP to None for network interface

tests.title: Disable Serial Port Access
tests.description: Determine if "Disable VM serial port access" policy is enforced at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: For security purposes, ensure that serial port access to your VM instances is disabled.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Disable VM serial port access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Disable VM serial port access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: Enforce Uniform Bucket-Level Access
tests.description: Determine if "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" policy is enabled at the GCP organization level.
tests.more_info: Enforcing Uniform Bucket Level Access ensures that access is granted exclusively through Cloud IAM service which is more efficient and secure.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint is enforced at the organization level.
tests.remediation_description: The "Enforce uniform bucket-level access" constraint will be enforced at the organization level.

results.message: Unable to query for organizations: Unable to obtain data

tests.title: KMS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are not publicly accessible.
tests.more_info: To prevent exposing sensitive data and information leaks, make sure that your cryptokeys do not allow access from anonymous and public users.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that your cryptographic keys are not accessible by allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.
